title: How to use 'so that' twice in a sentence - Quora

response.answer_text: Why would you want to use “so that” twice in a sentence, may I ask? There is little to no point in doing that, also I cannot think of a way that the sentence could be written in a grammatically correct way. Here are some examples of how you can use “so that” in sentences. 1. We must learn to crawl so that we can learn to walk. 2. Can you tell me what to do so that I can fly the plane? 3. At first, I didn’t understand what she said; she spoke slowly so that I could understand. We generally use the term “so that” we can link two ideas. The first idea is usually something that is required in order for the second idea to work.
